cubble 0.0.1.0000

    • 4. Application: Spatial and temporal aggregation

    Formulate or switch an object into a cubble in the nested form

    tamp.Rd

    Create a cubble object or switch an existing cubble object into the nested form

    tamp(data, key)

    Arguments

    data

    the data to be converted into a cubble object

    key

    the spatio identifier. Key can be automatically detected for a cubble object

    Details

    • For an object that is not cubble_df, tamp() will initialise a cubble object upon providing a group variable.

    • For an existing cubble in the long form, tamp() switches the object back to the nested form. This form is easier to computing group-specific variables.

    See also

    Other cubble verbs include stretch and migrate

    Examples

    # switch to the nested form from the long form
aus_climate %>%
  stretch() %>%
  tamp()
#> # cubble:   id [85]: nested form
#> # bbox:     [115.97, -43.32, 153.13, -12.42]- check gap on long
#> # temporal: date [date], prcp [dbl], tmax [dbl], tmin [dbl]
